t: For the choir director: according to “A Silent Dove Far Away.” A Miktam of David. When the Philistines seized him in Gath.
Be*pn gracious to me, God, for a man is trampling me; he*ln fights and oppresses me all day long.
My*ln adversaries trample me all day, for*ln many arrogantly fight against me.
When*pn I am afraid, I*ln will trust in you.
In*ln God, whose word I praise, in*ln God I trust; I will not be afraid. What*ln can mere mortals do to me?
They*pn twist my words all day long; all*ln their thoughts against me are evil.
They*ln stir up strife, they lurk, they*ln watch my steps while*ln they wait to take my life.
Will*ln they escape in spite of such sin? God,*ln bring down the nations in wrath.
You*pn yourself have recorded my wanderings. Put*ln my tears in your bottle. Are*ln they not in your book?
Then*ln my enemies will retreat on the day when I call. This*ln I know: God is for me.
In*pn God, whose word I praise, in*ln the Lord,*s whose word I praise,
in*ln God I trust; I will not be afraid. What*ln can mere humans do to me?
I*pn am obligated by vows to you, God; I*ln will make my thanksgiving sacrifices to you.
For*ln you rescued me from death, even*ln my feet from stumbling, to*ln walk before God in the light of life.
